metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5018 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The is_asn1 function in strongSwan 4.1.11 through 5.0.4 does not properly validate the return value of the asn1_length function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a (1) XAuth username, (2) EAP identity, or (3) PEM encoded file that starts with a 0x04, 0x30, or 0x31 character followed by an ASN.1 length value that triggers an integer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.1.2-0ubuntu1
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu1
libstrongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu1
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu1
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu1

criterions.comment: strongswan package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.2-0ubuntu1').
